metadata.titel_preek: The Baptism of Jesus: Epiphany and the New Thing

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God enters human history in the person of Jesus to defeat cosmic powers (Sin, Death, Devil) and fulfill all righteousness through baptism and the cross.

subject.identificatie: Jesus Christ / The Second Person of the Trinity
tekstueel_bewijs: The second person of the Trinity has arrived in human flesh to accomplish both of these impossibilities.
Jesus’ ministry... will consist of many exorcisms, demonstrating his lordship.

object.identificatie: The fulfillment of all righteousness and the deliverance of humanity from the dominion of darkness.
tekstueel_bewijs: delivering human institutions from bondage to the demonic powers
the voice of God speaks: 'This is my beloved Son'
the glory of the Father accomplishes this
he will make common cause with the chaff—which is all of us
transferred us to the kingdom of his beloved Son
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the 'chaff' or the 'baptizand').

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit and John the Baptist (as herald)
tekstueel_bewijs: the dove of the Spirit alight on his head
John is quite specifically linked to the Old Testament prophets
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject (Jesus) and the Helper (Spirit).

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and the Devil (Cosmic Powers)
tekstueel_bewijs: a demon prostrate in the water under his feet
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not merely bad habits but ontological 'dominions' and 'demonic powers' that require a divine subject to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer's response to baptism: walking in newness of life and yielding to God.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Baptized Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Instruments of righteousness / Newness of life
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is strictly a consequence of the primary program (Recapitulation).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: God the Father → Salvation/Righteousness → The Chaff (Us)

voorbeelden_god_subject: God in three Persons is determined to do this.
Christ deliberately submits to his suffering.
He has delivered us from the dominion of darkness.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We see him on the bank.

voorbeelden: you also must consider yourselves dead to sin
God in three Persons is determined to do this.
Teaching about the meaning of the sacrament should be the first order.
who is able to take away the sin of the whole world?

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'ability' of God to do what is humanly impossible. Grace is defined as the divine 'Pouvoir' invading the human 'impotence'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from S2 (Judgment/Fire) to Christ taking S2 upon himself, thereby moving the Receiver from ~S1 to S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Substitutionary and Recapitulatory: Christ becomes the 'chaff' to save the chaff.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'unquenchable fire' and 'dominion of darkness' are treated as objective realities.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It consistently places God/Christ as the active subject of salvation and treats human action as a secondary response to a 'momentous change of dominion'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Yield yourselves to God as men who have been brought from death to life.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He will relinquish his power as the reaper and will make common cause with the chaff—which is all of us.
The baptism of Jesus was an engagement with 'sin, death, and the devil'.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is not an example to follow but a Victor who effects a change of state.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: John the Baptist (as a witness, not a model for imitation)

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and awe; the burden of 'fulfilling righteousness' is shifted to Christ.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the cosmic victory (Christus Victor) to the individual sacrament (Baptism) is seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between Jesus as Judge (winnowing fork) and Jesus as Victim (Lamb).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He has delivered us from the dominion of darkness and transferred us to the kingdom of his beloved Son.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit empowers the Subject (Jesus) for his mission and qualifies the Receiver.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is an 'adversarial power' and 'impossibility' for humans to solve.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is powered by divine agency. Humans are the beneficiaries of a cosmic battle they did not fight.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the Epiphany theme of 'manifestation'.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'Devoir' (ethical response) remains clearly rooted in the 'Pouvoir' (divine enablement).

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as cosmic and demonic.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in theocentric preaching. It avoids the trap of making baptism a human work or Jesus a mere moral example.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'rock-star' metaphors, Greimasian analysis reveals that the 'engine' of the sermon is the transfer of dominion.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'dikaiosyne'; semiotics shows how that word functions as the 'Object' of value that only the divine Subject can attain.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'chaff' (usually an Opponent in sermons) is here transformed into the Receiver through the Subject's self-sacrifice.

appendices.notities: The sermon successfully utilizes Fleming Rutledge's grammar of grace by keeping God as the primary actor.
